data.title: History of Locally Filmed Movies in Cottonwood Arizona
data.meta_description: History, historical facts, legions like John Wayne, Elvis Presley, Mae West & more walked the streets of Old Town Cottonwood AZ. Hollywood filmed many movies in this small western Old Town.
data.text:
1931 - The Painted Desert

Western pardners find a baby boy in an otherwise deserted emigrants' camp, and clash over which is to be "father." Stars William Boyd, Clark Gable.

1940 - Arizona

Phoebe Titus is a tough, swaggering pioneer woman, but her ways become decidedly more feminine when she falls for California bound Peter Muncie. Stars Jean Arthur, William Holden.

1942 - Flying Tigers

The Flying Tigers are a band of American Mercenaries called upon by China to help fight the Japanese two years before Pearl Harbor. Stars John Wayne.

1947 - The Sea of Grass

A husband and wife on America's frontier. Stars Katherine Hepburn, Spencer Tracy.

1948 - Red River

Dunson is driving his cattle to Red River when his adopted son turns against him. Stars John Wayne, Montgomery Clift.

1948 - Blood on the Moon

When a shady-looking stranger rides into town to join his old friend it is assumed he is a hired gun. Stars Robert Mitchum, Barbara Bel Geddes, Robert Preston, Walter Brennan.

1950 - Copper Canyon

A performing sharpshooter is asked to help a beleaguered group of copper miners. Stars Ray Milland, Hedy Lamarr, Macdonald Carey, Harry Carey, Jr.

1951 - David and Bathsheba

Though David has all the wealth, power, wives & children inherent for the King of Israel he does not have what he craves most: the true love of a woman who loves him as a man instead of as King. Stars Gregory Peck, Susan Hayward.

1953 - Arena

Rodeo rider's marriage is endangered because of his commitment to the sport. Stars Gig Young, Polly Bergen, Harry Morgan.

1954 - Apache

Following the surrender of Geronimo the last Apache warrior is captured. Stars Burt Lancaster, Charles Bronson.

1955 - Oklahoma

A couple of young cowboys win the hearts of their sweethearts. Stars Gordon MacRae, Gloria Grahame.

1957 - 3:10 to Yuma

After outlaw leader is captured in a small town, his gang continues to threaten. Stars Glenn Ford, Van Heflin.

1957 - Gunfight at the O.K. Corral

Wyatt Earp decides to quit being a lawman and join his brothers in Tombstone, Arizona. Starring: Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas.

1957 - Aces: Iron Eagle III

Chappy discovers a drug-smuggling scheme at his own air base. Stars Lou Gossett, Jr.

1958 - The Big Country

Two families feud over water rights, and peace is brought about only with the deaths of the family heads. Stars Gregory Peck, Jean Simmons, Carroll Baker.

1959 - Rio Bravo

A small-town sheriff in the American West enlists the help of a cripple, a drunk, and a young gunfighter in his efforts to hold in jail the brother of the local bad guy. Stars John Wayne.

1960 - Ocean's 11

Eleven friends who know each other from World War II plan to rob five of the biggest casinos in Las Vegas. Stars Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin.

1960 - Cimmaron

The Cravet family builds their newspaper Oklahoma Wigwam into a business empire. Stars Glenn Ford.

1960 - Psycho

The Alfred Hitchcock classic about strange goings-on at the Bates Motel. Stars Anthony Perkins, Janet Leigh.

1962 - How the West Was Won

The history of Western expansion in the United States. Stars Henry Fonda, Lee J. Cobb.

1962 - The Legend of Lobo

No dialogue--just images and music. A family adventure film. Rex Allen, Narrator.

1963 - McLintock!

Cattle baron fights his wife, his daughter, and political land-grabbers. Stars John Wayne.

1963 - The Nutty Professor

To improve his social life, a nerdish professor drinks a potion that temporarily turns him into the handsome, but obnoxious, Buddy Love. Stars Jerry Lewis.

1965 - Arizona Raiders

An ex-Raider who's let out of jail with buddy are deputized as Arizona Rangers to hunt down the remnant of the gang, rumored to he hiding out in a town "neer dee border". Stars Audie Murphey.

1965 - Flight of the Phoenix

A cargo plane goes down in a sandstorm in the Sahara with less than a dozen men on board. Stars James Stewart, Richard Attenborough.

1967 - El Dorado

Hired gunman turns down a job with Bart Jason as it would mean having to fight an old sheriff friend. Stars John Wayne, Robert Mitchum.

1969 - Charro!

Man is innocently accused of having stolen a cannon from the Mexican revolutionary forces. Stars Elvis Presley.

1969 - Easy Rider

Two long-haired bikers from Los Angeles take off on a cross-country trip. Stars Peter Fonda, Dennis Hopper.

1969 - Mackenna's Gold

A gangster kidnaps Marshal McKenna because he believes that he has seen a map which leads to a rich vein of gold in the mountains. Stars Gregory Peck, Omar Sharif, Telly Savalas.

1969 - Whatever Happened to Aunt Alice

Loony woman lures housekeepers to her desert home to kill them and steal their savings. Stars Geraldine Page, Ruth Gordon.

1970 - Rio Lobo

An ex-union officer teams up with a couple of ex-Johnny Rebs to search for the traitor whom sold information to the south during the civil war. Stars John Wayne.

1971 - Billy Jack

Ex-Green Beret karate expert saves wild horses from being slaughtered for dog food and helps protect a desert "freedom school" for runaway. Stars Tom Laughlin.

1972 - Cancel My Reservation

Stars Bob Hope, Eva Marie Saint, Ralph Bellamy, Forrest Tucker, Chief Dan George, Anne Archer, Keenan Wynn.

1972 - Joe Kidd

Joe Kidd is a former bounty hunter and all-around tough-guy in the American Southwest during the Mexican-American War. Stars Clint Eastwood, Robert Duvall.

1972 - Junior Bonner

An over the hill rodeo rider has problems adjusting to the complexities of modern life. Stars Steve McQueen, Robert Preston, Ida Lupino.

1972 - Night of the Lepus

An Arizona ranch is overrun with scary rabbits. Stars Janet Leigh, Rory Calhoun, DeForest Kelly.

1973 - The Exorcist

Something beyond comprehension is happening to a little girl. Stars Ellen Burstyn, Max von Sydow, Lee J. Cobb, Linda Blair.

1974 - Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore

A recently widowed woman on the road with her precocious young son, determined to make a new life for herself as a singer. Stars Ellen Burstyn.

1976 - Hawmps

A story of the U.S. Army's experiment with using camels in the southwest. Stars Slim Pickens, Denver Pyle.

1976 - The Outlaw Josie Wales

Josey Wales makes his way west determined to live a useful and helpful life. He joins up with a group of settlers who need the protection that a man as tough and experienced as he is can provide. Stars Clint Eastwood, Sondra Locke, Chief Dan George.

1976 - A Star is Born

A rock star helps a singer achieve stardom. Stars Barbra Streisand, Kris Kristofferson, Gary Busey.

1977 - Lilies of the Field

An unemployed construction worker heading out west stops at a remote farm in the desert to get water when his car overheats. Stars Sidney Poitier.

1977 - Kingdom of the Spiders

Streets are overrun by killer spiders, trapping a small group of towns folk in a remote hotel. Stars William Shatner.

1979 - The Frisco Kid

Polish rabbi comes to America and befriends a bank robber. Stars Gene Wilder, Harrison Ford.

1980 - Used Cars

Used car salesman needs money to run for State Senate. Stars Kurt Russell, Jack Warden.

1981 - Cannonball Run

A wide variety of eccentric competitors participate in a wild and illegal cross-country car race. Stars Burt Reynolds, Roger Moore, Farrah Fawcett, Dom DeLuise, Dean Martin, Sammy Davis, Jr.

1982 - Hanky Panky

A complete innocent is drawn into a web of secrecy and government secrets when the sister of man who has committed suicide gets into a taxi-cab with him. Stars Gene Wilder, Gilda Radner.

1983 - National Lampoon's Vacation

The Griswold family's cross-country drive to the WallyWorld theme park proves to be much more arduous than they ever anticipated. Stars Chevy Chase, Beverly D'Angelo, Imogene Coca, Randy Quaid, Anthony Michael Hall.

1984 - Revenge of the Nerds

At a big campus, a group of bullied outcasts and misfits resolve to fight back for their peace and self respect. Stars Robert Carradine, Anthony Edwards, Timothy Busfield.

1984 - Roadhouse 66

Guy driving a '55 Thunderbird on Route 66 hooks up with another guy after hoodlum and his gang shoot his car. Stars Willem Dafoe, Judge Reinhold.

1985 - Murphy's Romance

A divorced woman with a teen aged boy moves into a small town and tries to make a go of a horse ranch. Stars Sally Field, James Garner.

1986 -Three Amigos!

Three unemployed actors accept an invitation to a Mexican village to replay their bandit fighter roles, unaware that it is real thing. Stars Chevy Chase, Steve Martin, Martin Short.

1986 - Desert Bloom

Flashbacks of a young person's coming of age. Stars Annabeth Gish, Jon Voight, JoBeth Williams, Ellen Barkin.

1986 - Nobody's Fool

After several failed suicide attempts a lonely and miserable woman has given away her baby for adoption - and regrets it now. Stars Rosanna Arquette, Eric Roberts, Mare Winningham.

1986 - Poltergeist II: The Other Side

The Freeling family have a new house, but their troubles with supernatural forces don't seem to be over. Stars JoBeth Williams, Craig T. Nelson, Heather O'Rourke.

1987 - Raising Arizona

When a childless couple of an ex-con and an ex-cop decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives get more complicated than they anticipated. Stars Nicolas Cage, Holly Hunter.

1987 - Can't Buy Me Love

Kid hires the prettiest cheerleader in school to be his girlfriend. Patrick Dempsey.

1987 - Creepshow 2

Three more anthology-type tales of terror.

1988 - Midnight Run

An accountant is chased by bounty hunters, the FBI, and the Mafia after jumping bail. Stars Robert De Niro, Charles Grodin.

1989 - Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure

Two seemingly dumb teens struggle to prepare a historical presentation with the help of a time machine. Stars Keanu Reeves, George Carlin.

1989 - Major League

An exotic dancer marries the owner of a baseball club. He does not survive the honeymoon and she is in control of his ball club. Starring: Tom Berenger, Charlie Sheen, Rene Russo, Wesley Snipes.

1990 -Fire Birds

Fighting drug cartels with air-to-air combat missions. Stars Nicolas Cage, Tommy Lee Jones.

1990 - Days of Thunder

A young hot-shot stock car driver gets his chance to compete at the top level. Stars Tom Cruise, Robert Duvall, Nicole Kidman, Randy Quaid.

1990 - The Grifters

When a woman's son is hospitalized after an unsuccessful con job and resultant beating, she finds that even an absentee parent has feelings for her child. Stars Angelica Huston, John Cusack, Annette Bening.

1991 - Grand Canyon

People in L.A. try to make connections with each other and be good people. Stars Danny Glover, Kevin Kline, Steve Martin.

1991 - The Story of Grand Canyon National Park

An educational film about the creation of this natural wonder.

1992 - The Story of America's Canyon Country

An educational film exploring the beauty of four states, including Arizona.

1992 - Benefit of the Doubt

A convicted wife murderer returns 22 year later to seek revenge on the daughter who help convict him. Stars Donald Sutherland, Amy Irving.

1992 - Wayne's World

Two slacker friends try to promote their public-access cable show. Stars Mike Myers, Dana Carvey. Rated R.

1992 - Beyond the Law

Undercover cop joins a murderous, arms-dealing biker gang to try to put them behind bars. Stars Charlie Sheen.

1993 -Suture

Brothers meet for the first time after their father's funeral and remark on how similar they look. One is plotting to kill the other and pass the corpse off as his own, to start a new life with his father's inheritance. Stars Dennis Haysbert, Mel Harris.

1993 - Bodies, Rest and Motion

Explores the relationship between physics and the characters. Stars Phoebe Cates, Bridget Fonda, Tim Roth, Eric Stolz.

1993 - Tombstone

After success cleaning up Dodge City, Wyatt Earp moves to Tombstone. Stars Kurt Russell, Val Kilmer, Sam Elliott, Bill Paxton, Dana Delaney.

1993 - Fire in the Sky

Based on a true story of a man in Arizona who believes he was abducted by aliens. Stars D. B. Sweeney. Rated PG-13.

1993 - Arizona Dream

An Innuit hunter races his sled home with a fresh-caught halibut. Stars Johnny Depp.

1993 - Forrest Gump

Multi-award winning film about a young man's travels across America. Stars Tom Hanks. 1993. Rated R.

1994 - The Getaway

Action/adventure film about a gangster and his wife. Stars Alec Baldwin and Kim Basinger. Rated R.

1994 - A Low Down Dirty Shame

An action comedy with a detective theme. Stars Keenan Ivory Wayans and Jada Pinkett. Rated R.

1994 - Blind Justice

A mysterious gunfighter left nearly blind from Civil War combat, roams through Mexico with a baby he has sworn to protect. Stars Armand Assante, Elizabeth Shue.

1994 - Boys on the Side

Comedy-drama-adventure about three women traveling across the country. Stars Whoopi Goldberg, Drew Barrymore, Mary-Louise Parker.

1994 - Lightning Jack

An Australian outlaw in the wild west. Stars Paul Hogan, Cuba Gooding, Jr., Beverly D'Angelo.

1994 - Maverick

Bret Maverick, needing money for a poker tournament, faces various comic mishaps and challenges, including a charming woman thief. Stars Mel Gibson, Jodie Foster, James Garner.

1994 - Natural Born Killers

A violent film about mass murderers and the media that loved them. Stars Woody Harrelson, Robert Downey, Jr. Rated R.

1994 -Pontiac Moon

An absent-minded-professor father and his son bond during a symbolic road trip through the Western U.S. while his wife tries to overcome her neuroses to save the family. Stars Ted Danson, Mary Steenburgen.

1994 - Stargate

An interstellar teleportation device, found in Egypt, leads to a planet with humans resembling ancient Egyptians who worship the god Ra. Stars Kurt Russell, James Spader.

1994 - The Quick and the Dead

A western drama about a beautiful gunslinger. Stars Sharon Stone, Gene Hackman, Leonardo DiCaprio.Rated R.

1994 - Terminal Velocity

Unsuspecting guy becomes involved with Russian mafia. Action/adventure. Stars Charlie Sheen, Nastassja Kinski. Rated PG-13.

1994 - Wyatt Earp

3-hour movie traces the life of Wyatt Earp. Stars Kevin Costner, Dennis Quaid, Gene Hackman.Rated PG-13.

1995 -The Prophecy

A priest who lost his faith becomes a cop instead. Stars Elias Koteas, Christopher Walken. Rated R.

1995 - Broken Arrow

High grossing adventure movie includes pilots, aircraft, nuclear bombs and such. Stars John Travolta, Christian Slater.Rated R.

1995 - Waiting to Exhale

Somewhat controversial film appealing more to women than men, explores male-female relationships. Stars Whitney Houston, Angela Bassett. Rated PG-13.

1995 -The Fantasticks

Matt and Louisa are tricked into falling in love by their fathers, who pretend to feud. Stars Joel Gray.

1996 - Flirting With Disaster

Man departs on a mission of discovery dragging his wife and 4 month old son behind. Stars Ben Stiller, Patricia Arquette, Tea Leoni, Alan Alda, Mary Tyler Moore.

1996 - Jerry Maguire

Blockbuster comedy/romance about a sports agent and an accountant with a cute kid. Stars Tom Cruise, Renee Zellweger, Cuba Gooding, Jr. Rated R.

1996 - Madhouse

The luxurious villa of a yuppie couple is overrun by loads of uninvited guests who turn the house up side down. Stars Kirstie Alley.

1996 - Mars Attacks

A star-studded spoof of science fiction movies. Stars Jack Nicholson, Glenn Close, Annette Bening. PG-13.

1996 - Ruby Jean and Joe

An old rodeo cowboy picks up a young, female hitchhiker. Stars Tom Selleck, Rebekah Johnson, JoBeth Williams. Made for TV. Rated PG-13.

1996 - Star Trek: First Contact

The crew tries to keep Earth's past and present in tact. Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes. Rated PG-13.

1996 - Tin Cup

Romantic comedy in a golf setting. Stars Kevin Costner and Rene Russo. Rated PG-13.

1996 - Vegas Vacation

Slapstick comedy with the Griswold family. Stars Chevy Chase and Beverly D'Angelo. Rated PG.

1997 - U Turn

A drifter becomes entangled with a femme fatale and her husband after his car breaks down in their small Southwest town. Stars Sean Penn, Nick Nolte, Jennifer Lopez. Rated R.

1997 - Contact

Dr. Ellie Arroway finds conclusive radio proof of intelligent aliens, who send plans for a mysterious machine. Stars Jodie Foster. Rated PG.

1997 - The Postman

A futuristic sci-fi movie about a postal delivery man. Stars Kevin Costner. Rated R.

1998 - Wild Wild West

Science fiction comedy western. Stars Will Smith, Kevin Kline, Kenneth Branagh. Rated PG-13.

1998 - Psycho

A young female embezzler arrives at the Bates Motel which has terrible secrets of its own. Stars Vince Vaughn, Ann Heche, Julianne Moore, William H. Macy, Viggo Mortenson. Rated R.

1998 - Three Kings

Acclaimed Gulf War action film. Stars George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg and Ice Cube. Rated R.

1998 - Mafia!

Comedy spoof about organized crime. Stars Lloyd Bridges, Christina Applegate. Rated PG-13.

1999 - The Highwayman

A dark, comedic thriller about fraud, bank robbers and a search for love. Stars Lou Gossett, Jr. Rated R.

1999 - Civility

A man must avenge his father's murder to receive $3 million. Also known as "The Day October Died." Stars Tom Arnold.

1999 - The Mummy

A French Foreign Legion soldier, who on an archaeological dig at the ancient city of Hamunaptra accidentally awakens the Mummy. Stars Brendan Fraser. Rated PG-13.

1999 - Storm of the Century

A small village off the mainland is about to receive a huge winter storm. Stars Timothy Daly. Rated PG-13.

1999 - Seven Girlfriends

Romantic comedy. Timothy Daly, Olivia D'Abo. Rated R.

2000- South of Heaven, West of Hell

A Marshal in the desolate Tucson territory of the early 1900's. Stars Dwight Yoakam, Billy Bob Thornton, Bridget Fonda. Rated R.

2000 - Nurse Betty

Comedy about a widow's post-traumatic obsession with a soap star. Stars Morgan Freeman, Renee Zellweger, Chris Rock, Greg Kinnear. Rated R.

2000 - Almost Famous

A high school boy is given the chance to write a story about a rock band as he accompanies it on a concert tour. Stars Billy Crudup and Frances McDormand. Rated R.

2000 - Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas

The Flintstones and the Rubbles go on a trip to Rock Vegas. Stars Mark Addy and Stephen Baldwin. Rated PG.

2000 -Traffic

A judge is appointed to spearhead America's escalating war against drugs, only to discover that his teenage daughter is a heroin addict. Stars Michael Douglas, Catherine Zeta-Jones. Rated R.

2000 - Held Up

While they're on vacation in the Southwest, woman finds out her man spent their house money on a classic car, so she dumps him, hitching a ride to Vegas for a flight home. Stars Jamie Foxx, Nia Long. Rated PG-13.

2000 - What Planet Are You From?

To save his planet, an alien must find a woman on Earth to have his baby. Stars Gary Shandling, Annette Bening, John Goodman, Greg Kinnear. Rated R.

2001 - Waking Up in Reno

A romantic comedy about two trashy couples traveling to Reno to see a monster truck show. Stars Patrick Swayze, Billy Bob Thornton. Rated R.

2001 - Eight Legged Freaks

Name changed from "Arac Attacks." A variety of horrible poisonous spiders get exposed to a noxious chemical which causes them to grow. Stars David Arquette. Rated PG-13.

2001 - Evolution

An alien organism has been rapidly evolving ever since its arrival on Earth inside a meteor. Stars David Duchovny, Julianne Moore. Rated PG-13.

2001 - The Forsaken

A young man battles vampires. Rated R.

2001 - Planet of the Apes

An astronaut lands on a planet inhabited by human-like apes, who rule the planet. Stars Mark Wahlberg, Tim Roth. PG-13.

2002 - Confessions of a Dangerous Mind

An adaptation of the cult memoir of game show impresario Chuck Barris. Stars Sam Rockwell, Drew Barrymore. Rated R.

2002 - Imposter

An engineer creates the ultimate weapon in a battle against aliens. Gary Sinise, Madeline Stowe. Rated PG-13.

2002 - Interstate 60

It began as a wish, became an adventure, and ended as the ultimate road trip. Stars Gary Oldman.

2002 - Windtalkers

Two U.S. Marines in WWII are assigned to protect Navajo Marines who know a secret radio code. Stars Nicholas Cage. Rated R.

2003 - Hulk

Bruce Banner, a genetics researcher with a tragic past, suffers an accident that causes him to transform into a raging green monster when he gets angry. Stars Eric Bana, Jennifer Connelly, Nick Nolte, Sam Elliott. Rated PG-13.

2003 - Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle

The Angels investigate a series of murders that occur after the theft of a witness protection profile database. Stars Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, Lucy Liu, Bernie Mac. Rated PG-13.

2003 - Blue Collar Comedy Tour

The comedic stylings of four funnymen in this documentary. Stars Jeff Foxworthy, Bill Engvall, Heidi Klum. Rated R.

2003 - View From the Top

A small-town woman tries to achieve her goal of becoming a flight attendant. Stars Gwyneth Paltrow, Christina Applegate. Rated PG-13.

2003 - Mona Lisa Smile

A free-thinking art professor teaches conservative 50's Wellesley girls to question their traditional societal roles. Stars Julia Roberts, Katherine Ann Watson, Kirsten Dunst, Julia Stiles, Maggie Gyllenhaal. Rated PG-13.

2004 - Raise Your Voice

A girl from a small town goes to Los Angeles to spend the summer at a performing arts high school. Stars Hilary Duff, Oliver James, David Keith, Rebecca De Mornay. Rated PG.

2004 - A Home at the End of the World

A dozen years in the lives of two best friends who couldn't be more different. Stars Andrew Chalmers, Ryan Donowho. Rated R.

2004 - Taxi

A feisty taxicab driver has hot tips for an inept cop set on solving a string of New York City bank robberies. Stars Queen Latifah, Jimmy Fallon. Rated PG-13.

2005 - Jarhead

Based on a former Marine's best-selling book about his pre-Desert Storm experiences in Saudi Arabia and fighting in Kuwait. Stars Jake Gyllenhaal, Jaimie Foxx. Rated R.

2005 - Transamerica

A transsexual learns that she fathered a son, now a teenage runaway hustling on the streets of New York. Stars Felicity Huffman, Elizabeth Pe√±a. Rated R.

2006 - Little Miss Sunshine

A family determined to get their young daughter into the finals of a beauty pageant take a cross-country trip in a VW bus. Stars Abigail Breslin, Greg Kinnear, Alan Arkin, Toni Collette. Rated R.

2006 - Glory Road

In 1966, Texas Western coach Don Haskins led the first all-black starting line-up for a college basketball team to the NCAA national championship. Stars Josh Lucas, Derek Luke, Jon Voight. Rated PG.

2006 - Wild Seven

A recently released convict seeks vengeance against his former partner who set him up for murder more than 20 years ago. Stars Richard Roundtree, Robert Loggia. Rated R.

2006 - Wild West Comedy Show: 30 Days & 30 Nights - Hollywood to the Heartland

In this documentary Vince Vaughn and four stand-up comedians travel the country and perform in 30 cities. Stars Vince Vaughn, Ahmed Ahmed. Rated R.

2006 - Zoom

Former superhero is called back to work to transform an unlikely group of kids into superheroes at a private academy. Stars Tim Allen, Courteney Cox, Chevy Chase. Rated PG.

2007 - Into the Wild

After graduating from Emory University, a young man abandons his possessions, gives his entire savings to charity and goes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Stars Emile Hirsch, Marsha Gay Harden, William Hurt, Jena Malone. Rated R.

2007 - The Kingdom

A team of U.S. government agents is sent to investigate the bombing of an American facility in the Middle East. Stars Jaimie Foxx, Chris Cooper, Jennifer Garner. Rated R.

2007 -Next

A Las Vegas magician who can see the future is pursued by FBI agents seeking to use his abilities to prevent a nuclear terrorist attack. Stars Nicolas Cage, Julianne Moore. Rated PG-13.

2007 - The Savages

A sister and brother care for their ailing father. Stars Laura Linney, Philip Seymour Hoffman. Rated R.

2007 - Transformers

An ancient struggle re-erupts on Earth between two extraterrestrial clans, the heroic Autobots and the evil Decepticons, with a clue to the ultimate power held by a young teenager. Stars Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Jon Voight. Rated PG-13.

2009 - Away We Go

A couple who is expecting their first child travel around the U.S. in order to find a perfect place to start their family. Stars John Krasinski, Maya Rudolph, Jeff Daniels. Rated R.

2009 - Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen

Deception forces return to Earth after the young hero learns the truth about the origins of the Transformers. Stars Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox. Rated PG-13.
